content: What is the best approach to divide the word "configure" into its constituent syllables while adhering to the phonotactics of the English language and not violating any stress patterns? Can you provide a solution using [XML data] code format?

Certainly! Dividing the word "configure" into its constituent syllables while considering English phonotactics and stress patterns involves understanding its phonetic structure. The word "configure" is pronounced as /kənˈfɪɡ.jʊr/, where the stress is placed on the second syllable. Here's how you could represent this structure using XML:

```xml
<word>
    <syllable>
        <phoneme>kən</phoneme>
    </syllable>
    <syllable stress="primary">
        <phoneme>ˈfɪɡ</phoneme>
    </syllable>
    <syllable>
        <phoneme>jʊr</phoneme>
    </syllable>
</word>
```

In this XML representation:
- Each `<syllable>` element contains a `<phoneme>` tag representing the phonetic breakdown of the syllable.
- The `stress` attribute is used to indicate the primary stress on the second syllable. 

This structure respects the phonotactics of the English language and highlights the stress pattern accurately.
